abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objectives of the Treasury
            Development Project for the Russian Federation are to ensure
            conditions for effective implementation of the budget, and
            enable the finance ministry to maintain budget oversight;
            and provide a transparent system of accounting that shows
            the utilization of the financial resources of the Government
            and enables management and audit of these resources. The
            extension is necessary to complete the ongoing Treasury
            System (FTAS) roll-out in all 83 regions, including the
            largest regions/cities in the country, such as Moscow and
            St. Petersburg (the Bank's experience in similar
            projects in many other countries would help the Federal
            Treasury (FT) in overcoming challenges that are likely to
            come up in these specific implementations); and ensure the
            successful completion of ongoing/remaining contracts for
            FTAS implementation over the course of the next 18 months
            (with remaining commitments worth about $100m, the
            Bank's continued supervision of FTAS implementation
            will help ensure that the elements of the Information and
            Communication (ICT) infrastructure are implemented smoothly
            and FTAS becomes fully functional by project end). This will
            be the third extension of the closing date of the project.
